Reviews.Title: “What an amazing trip ...”
Reviews.Author: MontyPal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were down in San Diego for our "babymoon". I booked the Palomar San Diego without knowing much about the hotel. I can say with certainty that it was an absolutely amazing experience -- one of the best we have ever had. The hotel is beautiful -- the decor is hip, and the rooms are massive. What really stood out to me, however, was the service. We were greeted by Johnson Menezes at the front desk. From the moment we met him, he ensured that every element of our stay was taken care of. From helping us get reservations at the perfect place for dinner, or setting us up with an absolutely amazing room with a view, Johnson really looked out for us. I credit a lot of our fantastic experience to his expertise! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Stop Looking, Just Book It... Now.”
Reviews.Author: HoldenCal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled from Calgary, Alberta to San Diego and searched online for a hotel and ended up booking the Kimpton Palomar. Man, we were not disappointed. When you travel to a new city, it's kind of a crap shoot to find a hotel based on pictures and reviews, because they are always mixed. Well, I can tell you this place won't disappoint. From the minute we pulled up to the valet, we were greeted by Chuy, and our experience was first rate from there. My wife and I are early to mid thirties (for reference), and we were blown away at how great this hotel was. From the modern design, beautiful hardwoods, and modern rooms, I would liken this hotel to staying at a friends house that is that new, modern style. We felt comfortable from the moment we entered the massive front door till we pulled away to head home. The staff are outstanding, very friendly and extremely helpful. Location is prime for San Diego, close to restaurants, music, the water, and even a few steps from drugstores, coffee shops, etc. As a bit of a techie, I always hope for lots of plugs to keep my iPhones, iPads and cameras fully charged and this hotel was great for that. The tv system is LodgeNet, so you can even control it from your iPhone/iPad using the LodgeNet app. The bed - Holy moses, this is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. You usually return from vacation and look forward to getting back to your own bed. Not this time. I think of that king size bed every night. And the pillows are just as comfortable. Bathroom - Travelling with my wife, occasionally we find bathrooms a little cramped for space but not at the Palomar. Tonnes of room, great stand up shower. Cleanliness - Our room looked just like the professional photos. Other - My wife and I were preparing for a night out and were standing outside the main door deciding where to go, when a crazy person started swinging her purse at people. The staff response was swift, and they restored calm for the patrons of the hotel. They are simply outstanding. Our main experience was with Chuy, and man, that guy is possibly one of the best I have ever met. Friendly, helpful, and informative. The three things you look for in hotel staff. From suggestions of places to see and things to do, Chuy made our stay first class. (See you next time dude). The pool - Man, what a great pool area. The seating and bar area are amazing, best in class. Must See - Go to Coronado.. great little day trip, and boardwalk area. If you are a nerd like us and have watched the OC, Laguna Beach, etc... it is a short drive north along the coast. La Jolla - Don't even think about it... just go there. It's beautiful. There are only two complaints... 1) The weather in San Diego was foggy for the entire weekend we were there. Kimpton, you make everything else beautiful, so please work on the weather. 2) The Pool area and Bar... not really a complaint, but it's only open til 8 pm. We like a lot of other travellers go out and explore all day, and we would have really loved to have the bar and pool area open till 10, 12 pm? It's a shame to have such a great area and it's closed every time you get back for the day... not really a complaint, but just a suggestion. Even 10 pm would be great. Thanks again Kimpton, we will be back...

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Playa del Rey, California, United States
Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend escape”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar on Saturday April 21st. I had been to several Kimpton Hotels in San Francisco and was excited to see what this one would be like since each one seems to have its own unique personality! I wasn't disappointed. From our first minute there, we had a great experience. Chuy at the door was extremely helpful. I had made a reservation for a special deal online and expected a nice room but had no idea what we were in store for! We stayed in a King room that had to be 600-700 sq feet. Everything was modern but comfy and the bed was extremely sleepworthy :) I loved the robes and the fact that the hotel provided plenty of towels so we didn't need to call for extras which we usually do. Everything was clean and the staff were very attentive, especially the manager, Johnson. The hotel is walking distance from everything so we didn't need to drive when we went our to meet friends in the Gaslamp district. The only downside which is not the hotel's fault is that if you self park your car you have to go three blocks away, but that seemed like only a minor hassle since one we were there we didn't need to go anywhere. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Douglas G
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Palomar San Diego was a great experience. The staff was all excellent, the room was very unique and what a great view from the balcony. You are walking distance to the Gas Lamp, great restaurants, a Padres game, the Bay and Horton Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: Bosejb
Reviews.Content: I travel about once a month and prefer to stay at fairly nice resorts/hotels. From the reviews and pictures I'd seen of Hotel Palomar I was excited to stay here during my three day weekend for a friend's wedding in San Diego. I may have had too high of expectations going into it, but at $300/night I didn't think it was unrealistic. The location of the hotel is great in relation to the gas lamp district, restaurants, bars, etc. The room was a bit small, but nice, loved the hardwood floors, and the bathroom/shower were fantastic. The best part of the hotel were the doormen, hands down. They were always helpful, chill, conversational, and good guys. With that being said, I do not think I will be returning to the Hotel Palomar for multiple reasons. During breakfast both mornings we were having to swat at the fruit flies constantly. There was not an abundance of them, but it seemed there was one circling the table and our food at all times. If you are looking to relax at the pool, get some sun, and have a few drinks....this may not be the place for you. The pool is located on the north side of the building, which means the sun is blocked from the entire pool area until about 1:30 in the afternoon. The pool bar was supposed to be open at noon, but the bartender did not arrive until 12:15 and took 45 minutes to set up the bar area. The upkeep on the wood and rusted metal for the furniture of the cabanas and beds near the bar is highly lacking. The planters in the wood behind the couch/beds near the bar are trashy, filled with junk, mixed dirt & rocks, and really should either be filled in with sand or rock.....or actually have plants in there to hide the trashy look. However, the individual whipping up the cold menu at the pool was awesome and his food was great. I would not say that it was a bad stay by any means, but I was not impressed to the point of wanting to return. Obviously the location of the pool relative to the position of the sun is not something that anyone can help, but the attention to detail and upkeep would go a long way in elevating this hotel to the standards I believe they attempt to be held in.

Reviews.Title: “Brown, brown and brown”
Reviews.Author: psjofors
Reviews.Content: If you like brown, this is the place for you. The floors are brown. The walls are brown. The drapes are brown. The chairs, the tables, doors.... Just about everything is dark chocolate brown. I was around in the 1970s when brown was THE color, and I did not like it then, don't like it now. The staff was very nice, the gym nice, and the hotel restaurant surprisingly good. The room, bed and bathroom comfortable. But, there was small nagging things that, if fixed, would have made this a top rated place; the drink selection in the mini-bar was very poor; I was missing some kind of little dish to put nuts etc in, and not have to dig into the bags to fish them up, there was no table for room service to put a tray on, there was no glasses in the bathroom; there was only one bar of soap - non for the shower. I had a corner room with a balcony and, in this larger room, the TV was too far away or too small for the distance. The balcony was completely emily, and a couple of chairs and small table would have made it useable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: 13Christine_B13
Reviews.Content: This property is just fantastic! Before we arrived, I contacted the hotel with questions about how to get around in the city. They got right back to me with directions and even offered to drive me to locations that were within a few miles of the hotel. The location turned out to be within walking distance to so many of San Diego's great attractions. The staff was exceptionally friendly and welcoming. Our room was lovely and very comfortable. Coffee and tea was set up for guests in the morning, lemon or delicious cucumber water was out for us later in the day, and then a wine hour in the evening. I felt at home here in this wonderful hotel in such a beautiful city. Sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: AnitanurseOxnard
Reviews.Content: Actually a block north of the gaslamps, but very centrally located to great dining, shops and a movie theater. PROS: Staff are very friendly and accomodating. Late check out was no problem. Wine in the lobby in the afternoon was fun. Coffee & tea in the lobby in the morning. The pool area bartender was fantastic & the food was great. We shared a pulled pork sandwich that was terrific. Great views from the pool deck, worth a visit! Comfy beds. CON: Can hear folks in the hallway. Bathroom door is a slider that you can slam your finger in when closing, so be careful. Overall a great place to stay, I am a big fan of the Kimpton group of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: skge
Reviews.Content: So we stayed there several days and the trip morphed from family time to girls weekend (part with my husband and child, part without). I can truthfully say that regardless of the situation (crazy child running around) or lounging during wine hour, we felt welcome and cared for. They cared and responded to our requests (clippers, fixing a leaking outdoor shower, coffee mugs ) without hesitation and without raising an eyebrow. Living in the bay area I am not accustomed to such hospitality (W and Fairmonts weren't even on par with Palomar's service). I crave that level of hospitality when I stay at a hotel. These days I want to a) be in the heart of it all b) be pampered c) take it up a notch. This hotel had it all and more. And I am a frugal shopper. My husband went to Coachella while I walked about, trolleyed about, biked about. A great time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recent business trip and was very pleased with the look and feel of the Hotel, but more impressed by the Staff of the Palomar. They went above and beyond to accommodate, were very freindly. The bar and restaurant had great food and drinks. It is always nice to see smiling staff when you are missing the comforts of home! Great job staff - I will defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Trip Stay”
Reviews.Author: Caryn S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palomar in San Diego March 12 - 15th and loved it. The rooms were great, and the staff was even better. Pricing was reasonable as well. I enjoyed the convenience of the location. I would recommend this property to anyone whether they were traveling for business or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, warm welcome, understated easy look and feel”
Reviews.Author: parmantom
Reviews.Content: I was rather surprised and pleased with initial look and feel of the Hotel, it was my first stay and thus i was unaware of this kimpton brand - which I think can be summed up as in the same territory as the W brand, but on a smaller more intimate scale. This San Diego version had a warm and consistent daily welcome, good colour scheme (i.e. not that eternal beige experience you get across the USA), my room was not carpeted!! quality facilities and provisions - for the price $sub 200, it was ideal. The hotel is dark wood, sophisticated style which i hate to say (knowing how i dislike being marketed to) worked for me... Situated at the top of 5th street and core of gaslamp quarter it you have been to san diego before you will know it is really a one street (5th) town with a convention sprawl water front and then not much else in terms of charming bits - so this hotel gives you that advantage. Good hotel bar, breakfast is quite average and dull but why stay in - probably the reason it is sub-quality. Not all rooms have a bath seemingly, but those that dont have a cavernous psycho style shower.

Reviews.Title: “love Kimpton hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar San Diego for two reasons: 1) we enjoy the boutique size and service of Kimpton hotels and because of their highly evolved pet friendly attitude, and 2) it was located next door to the House of Blues, where a good friend was competing in a "laugh-off" charity event. We did not travel with our dog for this trip, but enjoyed the property anyway. The pool area was so nice (and they arranged for a lovely warm, sunny afternoon [not unusual in San Diego]). We didn't try the happy hour or the restaurants because of other commitments, but the hotel and the lobby were lovely and inviting. The front door to the hotel is very cool; it's huge. I felt a little like Alice in Wonderland going in. The front desk personnel were extraordinarily helpful - just what I expect from Kimpton Hotels. One note, when we return to San Diego with our dog, I think we will try Kimpton's Salomar instead of the Palomar because there are grassy areas closer to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Cali !”
Reviews.Author: Dogdayzing
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights with my boyfriend who I had not seen in a month! Beautiful property, location awesome, staff was excellent and so friendly. I would def stay here again. Only had breakfast one morning but the bar was fun. You can walk to everything! Gaslamp, Seaport village, the mall,etc The weather was cool so we didnt use the pool but it looked great. The bed was comfy and the shower was beautiful and always fast with hot water. 2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, So-So Design”
Reviews.Author: LaJollaJoe
Reviews.Content: We spent a night away at the Hotel Palomar and had a lovely time. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the service impeccable. We did run into a number of problems, owing largely to a lack of attention to detail. Please read "cons" below. Pros: - Excellent Gaslamp location - Fun design - Great service - Quiet rooms - Amenities, such as spa, restaurant and fitness center. Cons: - Rooms are "cold" with many hard surfaces. - Light switches were hard to find. - Bathroom was spacious, yet had no counter space for toiletry storage. - Rooms lacked carpeting and floor was cold in the morning. - Spa was not open when we came for our scheduled appointment. - Spa did not have hairdryer, yet a shampoo and shower was necessary after therapist used oil on the scalp. - Restaurant forgot parts of our order. - Very, very expensive parking, mini bar, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: libser
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while on business and was the meeting planner as well. The service was outstanding (front desk, in-room, catering, AV etc). Some of the meeting attendees had MAJOR problems with the room block (the site would not recognize them and kept quoting them a $500 a night cost which was about $360 above what the room block was actually priced.) This caused significant problems with several of the attendees. Then, one of our attendees was "walked" (hotel was over-booked and they did not have a room for her, even tho she had a guaranteed reservation.) They put her in another Kimpton 8 blocks away but they did comp her the one night's lodging. The beds and bathrooms were fantastic (rain shower with the best water pressure I've seen in years. Made me wonder how this fits the current water restrictions standards from the federal government) . The conference registrants were raving about the rooms, the location and most of all-the GINORMOUS front metal door that swings on a pin. Everyone was fascinated with it. The only problem (outside of the forced "walk" of a registrant) is that I was awakened at 5 am with a foul, FOUL smell coming into my room. (I was street facing, 3rd floor). After a few minutes,the smell was just as (if not) stronger. I wondered if I needed to get out of bed, get dressed and outside-due to some plumbing/chemical leak. Instead, I called the front desk who informed me that the House of Blues Restaurant (right next door) was cleaning their grease traps. Could not go back to sleep so I was up from 5 am on. The smell continue for 30-40 minutes and was still lingering in my room that afternoon. Was not offered any compensation for this.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay....”
Reviews.Author: t0309999
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean. I did have a difficult time finding the hotel because the signs are not good :-) but managed at the end. Car park is expensive but then again its downtown. It takes about 10 minutes from the airport to drive to the hotel. I enjoyed the stay i have to say.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: larryderm
Reviews.Content: The suites are enormous, and the staff are friendly. The bathroom fixtures are eccentric with the sinks being shallow. The living room could easily accommodate twenty people for a cocktail party. The views are lovely. The downside is the maid service - sloppy at best. There is no turn down service, and the amenities, including soap, are sparse. I arranged for several food functions. The pricing is high; the selection is mediocre; and the portions are sparse.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: UUGeekGirl
Reviews.Content: The staff here is amazing - Anyone who has stayed at a Kimpton hotel knows the staff is top notch, friendly and attentive, but the staff at the Palomar San Diego is outstanding. We really enjoyed our stay here in February. Everyone greeted us by name each day and my daughter delighted in all the attention. They were so wonderful with her.. they indulged her each afternoon as she chattered about what she had seen that day. She loved the goldfish they brought to our room (thanks Astrid!) We were so grateful for the fruit, the manager, Johnson, packed for her each morning -- the tourist places didn't really have anything resembling healthy food. Gilbert and Michael were so helpful, taking my mother-in-law and daughter to nearby places in the house car.. she didn't have to worry about tracking down a cab, she just called when they were getting ready to leave. Made it so easy for her. The hotel has a great location in the gaslamp quarter, near tons of restaurants and sightseeing spots. The hotel is very modern, the giant front door is neat. Our room was great, clean lines, posh bedding, everything very comfortable. Internet access was fast too, had no problems skyping my husband so he could say goodnight to our daughter. The only problem we had, was that the shower isn't very kid friendly. Heavenly for grownups with a wide, rain style showerhead, but the floor of the shower is too slippery for a toddler. No worries, the staff was very accommodating and happily switched us to a room with a bathtub! Just keep it in mind if traveling with kids. Overall they really made us feel welcome and took great care of us, especially my daughter. So refreshing from other hotels! A month later, and I can still name most of the staff.. Johnson, Astrid (my daughter thought she was the little mermaid!), Nicole, Chuy, Gilbert & Michael -- and so can my daughter. Thanks for your hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: stiney23
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego in January 2012 for a small getaway. We have always enjoyed Kimpton hotels and this one didn't disappoint. Everyone at the hotel was incredibly friendly. Our room was spotless, we upgraded to one of the flats and have so much space. Our TV in the living room didn't work as I have seen others complain about, but it seemed to be just the HD channels and honestly, it wasn't a deal breaker. My only complaint was the parking, but you are in a major city and its to be expected. It was very expensive and took awhile to get the car. The best part is the location, about 10 minutes to the airport, walking distance to all restaurants and bars. It is on the edge of town where you can see things changing, but again your in a major city and its to be expected wherever you travel. Pros: Excellent customer service, location, gorgeous hotel Cons: parking

Reviews.Title: “GREAT GETAWAY HOTEL WITH EXCELLENT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: parkerant
Reviews.Content: Personally I prefer this location in all of the city, it is within walking distance to everything, and it is a quieter location overall especially after dark when the city action is pumping very loud. But still next door to The House of Blues, so you can take part in the action without enduring the noise. Very cool, hip hotel with all the unique design materials expected of a contemporary hotel. The vault type front door is very unique and the rooftop pool/bar area is very relaxing, with great views of the city skyline and a 85 degree pool make it fabulous to enjoy year round. The staff are exceptional, very friendly, attentive and knowledgeable about the area dining, activites etc. Especially the coolster Concierge Michael Chacon, he is in the know about everything San Diego, and helpful in arranging anything needed. I hear the Saltbox onsite restaurant is awesome too, not enough time to enjoy, but the bar area is fabulous and very funky & inviting. They have a great hosted wine hour, and amazingly they serve very good wine, white & red, another great value. The rooms are contemporary and sleek, the bathroom rain shower is a highlight as welol as the most comfortable mattress, down comforter and feather pillows. One of the best nights sleep in a hotel to be had! I believe after Kimpton has a chance to make a few upgrades to this newly purchased hotel, it could only get better. And the fact that they allow pets without an extra charge is a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Jaydot11
Reviews.Content: The staff made my 25th birthday this weekend the most memorable! Best experience at a hotel ever! Johnson a manager took care of me and my guests! I stayed on the 16th floor in a huge suite and loved it! Thanks guys !

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. Not as nice as some Kimptons.”
Reviews.Author: SusanM202
Reviews.Content: I thought the rooms were a little odd, kind of dreary. The decor was some blend of "trendy with a seaside theme." That said, the beds are the same from one Kimpton to the next.....fabulous!!!!! The most comfortable beds in the world! (In my humble opinion, that is.) Room service was prompt, bar and restaurants were "ok." I'll probably stay there again to get my Kimpton points but it is not my favorite hotel. Not bad, just average in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are great, rooms have a couple minor issues”
Reviews.Author: BC-Westcoaster
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for 4 nights in February 2012. The hotel has recently been taken over by Kimpton and fully redone, and it looks great, very modern. The location is pretty good, right downtown and walking distance to lots of restaurants and the shopping centre. The rooms are smallish, which is to be expected for the location. We arrived early and were able to check in right away, which was appreciated. We were "upgraded" to a room with a balcony - I wouldn't pay extra for this, as the balcony is tiny (no room for a chair) and there is no view to speak of. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable, if a little soft. The bathroom has just a sliding door on it, there is no separate door for the toilet area, and the shower has just a half glass wall, so you'd better be comfortable with your travelling partner. The shelf in the shower is slanted, presumably so water doesn't pool on it, but the unfortunate consequence is that toiletries have a tendancy to slide right off the shelf and onto the shower floor. There is no tub, which was fine for us but may be an issue for others. There is no carpeting in the rooms as it is all hardwood - fine for us, but those travelling with children may have an issue with this. Parking is $36 valet, and there is no self-parking on the site, though this is fairly standard for an older building in the downtown area. The valet staff were very prompt and friendly. The hotel offers free wi-fi. There are no ice machines available, but the front desk staff will happily provide ice on request. There are also no water/pop machines on the floors, but there is a drug store across the street from the hotel. All the staff we encountered from the front desk to the valet to housekeeping were pleasant and helpful. We got a decent rate booking online and would certainly consider staying here again if the rate was as good and our stay was for just a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Dog owners”
Reviews.Author: christine j
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and it's great that they don't have pet restrictions, however, they should really describe where to take the dogs out in the pet section and not in the FAQ's where I found this information after our shortened stay. We have 3 dogs and to take them to the bathroom you have to leave the hotel and take them outside in the streets to have them go every time. So inconvenient, I guess it's easier if you have one dog but still, so beware dog owners!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: netherk
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a comfortable hotel for a weekend escape from the working week in LA. I treated myself to a junior suite and didn't regret it. Room was comfortable, spacious and clean and staff were very friendly and helpful. As I didn't have a car, location was important to me and I was able to walk or get a short taxi ride to San Diego Zoo, Balboa Park and harbour drive. The highlight, by far, was the spa within the hotel who were able to book an appointment for me at late notice and provided an incredibly relaxing massage! Would recommend the hotel for anyone who wants to treat themselves!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with nice service”
Reviews.Author: NorthCarolinaBella
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palomar, San Diego in late January. Staff was very helpful when our trip was delayed a day due to our flights being rescheduled. When I checked in early due to a very early flight, they had my room ready and I was able to go right in. Beautiful rooms, but be prepared,out boutique room was quite small. Very comfortable bed! Linens very very plush. Just not a lot of room to move about in if you plan to stay a while and spend a lot of time in your room. They may have larger rooms, so make sure you check. The price was quite expensive, but about in line with other boutique hotels I checked out. I had read reviews that the hotel was quite noisy, but I did not find that to be a problem at all. Elevators were very fast and prompt. Never had to wait even though I was on an upper floor. The pool area was beautiful and that was initially why I chose this hotel instead of another. Did not get a chance to try the hotel restaurant. This hotel was nicely located, within walking distance to most of downtown and right in the gas lamp district. Lots of places to eat and things to do. I visit San Diego frequently and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: tahoeed
Reviews.Content: Kimpton Palomar is another jewel in this chain's properties. Within easy waliking distance to over 60 restaurants and bars in the Gaslamp district and short walking distance to Petco Park, the convention center, Little Italy and the harbor area. The rooms are amazing and the beds are as comfortable as can be, No street sounds to interrupt sleep. Wonderful pool, exercise room and spa. Nice bar and restaurant. The staff was amazing from doormen to housekeeping. Pet friendly and an excellent value for the price. Valet parking pricey, but worth it. We'd stay again and again. Not great for kids, but perfect for couples.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel ~ great experience”
Reviews.Author: Lachi S
Reviews.Content: The staff is super warm and friendly ~ Mike, a waiter in the Saltbox is a treasure trove of "what to do in San Diego". The food was freshly prepared and delicious. ~ the room was sumptious and comfortable and uber clean. Bed was VERY comfortable. Room amenites generous. We had a great stay and wished it had been longer.

Reviews.Title: “Short but Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Saltrat
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Palomar when in San Diego for business this week. I'm a big fan of the Kimpton chain, and I've never gone wrong in staying at their hotels. The Palomar was no exception. My room was relatively large and a good value. Nice wood floors in the room (much cleaner than carpet), the typical comfortable bed and pillows, and generally nice furnishings. However, I did miss the Aveda bath products I've grown to expect at Kimpton hotels. The only contact I had with the staff was at check in and check out, and the front desk employee was friendly and efficient in both instances. The location of the hotel is excellent. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not yet 100% Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: I have to say the staff and the service at this hotel was amazing, no one missed a beat. Even the Valets were great when a certain teddy bear was left in the car causing a 2 year old to go into a panic state... I love the Wine hour a great way to unwind and meet other guest. We did go in the pool and that area is very nice. 2 things I will tell you about the stay that I did not love, The bathroom door! It would get stuck it was very wobbly and with this heavy frosted glass did not give you privacy, I was not at all a fan of the door, traveling with a small child it seemed very unsafe. My guess is they may still be updating the rooms to full Kimpton standards and will probably upgrade these to be on a nice safe track system. Second is the location, I love the gaslamp but this may not be my preferred property when traveling with children. Fine for adults but when I stayed and walked to dinner and breakfast, both times we were surrounded by numerous homeless people, so next time I go to San Diego I may go to the Kimpton that is closer to the beach and not downtown. those are the only 2 draw backs and again the service was great

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room for a fabulous price:-)”
Reviews.Author: Tohono
Reviews.Content: I always try to stay at Kimpton hotels when I travel and I have never been disappointed. My room at the Palomar was located on the 13th floor and it was really fancy. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. Happy hour was a lot of fun with a life band. I ate at the bar of the adjacent Saltbox and had excellent shrimp ceviche tacos as well as tasty mussels. I will definitely stay there again the next time I visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar - excellent, chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shweta G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a bachelorette party. The style of the hotel is contemporary. It's very chic and beautiful. The staff is helpful and sweet. They helped me coordinate a party at the Saltbox and also a Spa day at the Se Spa. Beds are extremely comfortable and staff was very accommodating when I needed extra linens at an inconvenient hour. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a party or just a relaxing getaway. Also, lots of stuff to do nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful Reservations Team Perfect Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Matt H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find and is the perfect location if you're looking to be in downtown San Diego - right in the heart of the Gas Lamp District. Kimpton Hotels are Pet Friendly and do not charge a fee (which is appreciated)- so we brought Rollie, our Yorkie along for the weekend. Each Team Member was in love with pets so he felt at home. The valet/parking fee was reasonable & prompt upon arrival and when we needed the car. The nightly wine reception was nice & we partook one evening while waiting for dinner reservations. Our room was spacious and well laid out. Hardwood floors were nice and gave an overall "clean" and germ free feeling. Rainfall shower was nice as were the marble floors. On the second evening, a server arrived with a kind note with well wishes and in-room amenity from the reservations team for a competition we'd be at. Very unexpected and thoughtful. We enjoyed Louisiana cooking at the next block over for lunch one evening and a wine bar that was Alice & Wonderland themed another evening. Their restaurant Saltbox looked great, but due to our schedule, we missed it. There was a neat place called The Local that had a great sandwich and burgers 3 blocks up. Excellent stay & excellent staff!

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: joydot
Reviews.Content: when the lobby doubles as a bar and the "heated" but in fact unheated pool area is designed to be a drinking lounge you have need to be concerned. especially as a biz traveller who might need some sleep. the staff were not overly concerned with anything, if we had this experience at a 3 star hotel i'd be as unimpressed as i am with this stupid ipad2. the room overlooked one of the loudest service plant setups ever but the alternate was the pool/bar area. parking is a nightmare so the hotel charges you $36 usd /day to make up for this. its tad too far to walk with kids to anything worth walking to. we were booked for what was intended to be a relaxing week but when the soft beds did in one back and threatened to do in another we shifted after 3. must try harder.

Reviews.Title: “Dogs and/or Kids Kimpton is the only way!”
Reviews.Author: DrewCrew_515
Reviews.Content: My family and I are Kimpton rewards members, and quickly became members after our first stay in a Kimpton Hotel. They are VERY kid friendly and they are also pet friendly (at no extra cost for either). We had previously stayed at the Salomar in San Diego and were excited to try the new Palomar! Absolutly LOVED IT! I wont lie I was concerned when we arrived on a Friday night, as the Gaslamp area was moving at the nightlife pace and it was next to the House of Blues! From the valet service, to the the lobby and front desk service, all worries quicly disappeared! Our kids LOVED the giant door you can walk through. Our room as we reserved was ready, two double beds, hardwood floors throughout, GIANT walk-in shower, crib ready, and dog bed and bowels! I expected nothing less from a Kimpton Hotel and we were not disappointed one bit with the Palomar! We had a wonderful recommendation to go have breakfast at Brians 24 around the corner, there is a nice shopping area/mall within walking distance, and if you forgot anything, dont worry, there is a CVS across the street. (It even has the old fashioned Thrifty Ice Cream!) Needless to say we loved it, beautiful top to bottom, not a hint of street noise, but close enough to everything! Upon my return, I have booked myself and the rest of my co-workers at the hotel for a conference in April at the Convention Center. Cant wait to return

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: glamtrav
Reviews.Content: Where do I start...I absolutely adore this place! I had a suite (flat) and when I tell you that the room (1406) rocked, it so did! I am still raving about this place. When I entered my room, I was greeted by soft Jazz playing all throughout the suite and the lights were dim. A fresh bucket of ice sat on the dining room table, which was lit by a fashionable lamp. Ahhhh, I felt like I was in a movie. By lifting the shade slightly, from the living room to the bathroom, I had a view of downtown San Diego, with huge windows. I had a balcony that could fit 8-10 people comfortably. Two robes, one (large) in the closet(Leopard) and one laying on the bed (Zebra). Three closets, one in the living area, two (small) in the bedroom area, of which one had an elite Keurig coffee machine with contents. Two flat screen t.v.'s, one in the bedroom and one in the living room area. Two bathrooms, one when you initially walk into the suite and the other in the actual bathroom area. The bedroom bathroom, which was huge, had a separate tub and rainforest shower. And I did use both. I liked the hardwood floors throughout the suit and also the retractable glass sliding doors. Each day, my room was cleaned and one night, I was on my balcony and I heard some noise in the room so I went in to look around and I was scared at first, but then I saw a woman who was only putting a fresh bag of ice in the room. How nice?!?! I didn't eat in the restaurant, but I did use the commentary happy hour in the lounge area. It gets pretty crowded too, which is nice for socializing. Be careful is you aren't used to the modern way of doing things, this hotel has unisex bathrooms in the dining area upstairs... I have to give it up to the Palomar. I didn't want to leave. The staff greets you with open arms and you can tell that they love their jobs. They made me feel comfortable beyond means, which is important when you leave your home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: CherylKyp
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Palomar in San Diego because it is a now a Kimpton Hotel, and we are Kimpton In-Touch members. We specifically stayed here because Kimpton is known for it's "pet-friendly" atmosphere, and we like to travel with our two small dogs. The Palomar was no exception. The staff is so friendly (and dog-friendly) and helpful, and really went out of their way to make our trip enjoyable. It's hard enough to travel with pets, and finding a luxury hotel that accepts them (and with open arms) is more tough. The staff had great suggestions on parks, bars and restaurants where dogs are welcome. They also had dog treats waiting for them upon check-in, dog beds set up in our room, along with food and water bowls. We didn't use their other dog services, but frequently saw the staff members providing dog-walking and dog-sitting services for other guest. It's very unusual to find such a nice hotel that provides those services as well. As far as the location, it can't be beat. Right in the heart of downtown San Diego, surrounded by plenty of restaurants, shops and bars. Walking distance to plenty more than you would want to do, including Seaport Village. It really didn't get much better. As far as the room, it was comfortable and cozy. The bathroom was clean and contemporary as well. I wish the parking for hotel quests was a little less than $36/night, but the room rate was more than reasonable. We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property with a wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lori C
Reviews.Content: Simply put....we were treated like "Rock Stars" the entire weekend! Our twin boys were celebrating their 9th birthday and although I did include that information in the on line booking I made, I certainly did not expect the exceptional treatment we received from check-in to check out. Every employee at this property went out of there way to ensure our children were made to be very special. The property is modern and gorgeous and although we only ate breakfast at the hotel...it was superb. Service was excellent as was the food. The attention to detail at this hotel is far superior to many. A special thanks to Astrid...who went above and beyond to make our stay so memorable. Johnson...Thank you also for being so welcoming. Gilbert...you da man!...made quite an impression on the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, sumptuous room, free wine, street noise...”
Reviews.Author: BernardRene
Reviews.Content: The good stuff: Palomar's are typically upscale, very modern, hip, comfortable hotels. This property lived up to the reputation of other gorgeous Palomar Hotel's I've stayed. The lobby was inviting and beautiful. The bar...well...let's just say that I could move into the bar and be quite comfortable. The staff was friendly and beautiful (I swear, Kimpton consistently hires from Hollywood Central Casting - a very diverse and attractive staff). My room and bathroom were beautifully appointed and very comfortable. Plus, all Kimpton's that I've visited provide a free wine "happy hour" from 5-6pm, and free coffee/tea in the morning. My favorite color is free, so I indulged, gladly. The hotel is VERY conveniently located in the heart of the Gaslamp district, walking distance to various restaurants, bars, clubs, and other hotels. The bad stuff: Valet parking is $36 a night. Seriously?! In this neighborhood (sketchy), you actually WANT to valet park, so suck up and pay it...however...ouch! My room was on the 8th floor, but I could still hear the street noise at 1am when revelers were leaving bars/clubs and noisily yelling in the street. Not fun. That said...I'll stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Whether its business or leisure, let the staff at the Kimpton take care of you!”
Reviews.Author: Michele_N808
Reviews.Content: No matter which Kimpton myself and my family stay at the staff has been phenomenal! The first Kimpton we stayed at in Alexandria,Va, we had all three of our children with us. The gentleman who brought us up to our room mentioned the different types of pillows they had and the kids were excited! Do you know he went out of his way to bring EVERY single pillow up to our room! The kids had so much fun! The Palomar is gorgeous! The pool is warm and the food is orgasmic and again..... Their staff is the best!!!!!! The location is berfect as well. Great stuff to do both day and night near here! Thank you Corrie and Johnson for making us feel so special and welcome!

Reviews.Title: “One night stand”
Reviews.Author: Solo67_4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night after finding a deal on a room. For the ultra modern, less is more fans, this is the hotel for you. The location is fine for walking the gas lamp area for sights and food options. Parking is expensive via valet but then again I felt better (after seeing some of the street "characters") that my car was not in a public parking lot. Valet attendants are friendly and helpful. They retrieved my car once for me when I forgot one of my bags and coat. The parking is not on site; so I appreciate the extra effort. Check-in was a breeze, friendly while efficient. The room while modern is sparse with high ceilings and wood floors. Minimal decor, small television for those who wish to watch some tv to relax. The beds are comfortable, I found the pillows to be on the hard side. The bathroom is modern but you will have to fuss with the knob for the shower to get them temperature right. It is not an easy one way hot, the other way cold or progressive hot to cold. The mini bar is expensive (the usual) but I did not find any vending machines. No ice bucket for the room. BYOB of soda or what not for the small fridge! You can hear the hummm of city traffic below; I turned on the AC fan and it seemed to help drown out some of the noise. My room was on the 9th floor. Finally the front entrance zen fortress style door is rather funny. It does not add much to the ambiance of the hotel but rather is a pain in the rear to move to get in or out of the hotel. I would not stay here again. For me; it was an okay experience for the deal I received. If I had payed full price; I would be a little more picky and probably disappointed. *****if you join the Kimpton in touch program but book through a third party you will not receive points or rewards. The only upgrade was free Wi-Fi and most hotels have free Wi-Fi. You have to book through the hotel directly (Full price) for rewards or free upgrades eventually******

Reviews.Title: “Great place to host an event!!”
Reviews.Author: FASD
Reviews.Content: Great place to host an event!! Very helpful staff and great location. Thanks to Jenn and Corrie for their support with all of the details!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people!”
Reviews.Author: JD419
Reviews.Content: A business/pleasure trip for 3 days. Our first at a Klimpton property. It is in the Gaslamp district and very close to many restaurants, bars and opportunities for night life. And an easy walk (15 min) to the water front ferry to Coronado or any of the sights along the water. Seaport Village is only a few minutes more, past the USS Midway. The people we encountered at the Palomar were friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. And the bellmen were all very good and Gilbert was exceptional... truly an employee who loves his job.

Reviews.Title: “Palomarginal”
Reviews.Author: blissfork
Reviews.Content: Maybe marginal is not the right word. Nothing about the hotel is WRONG, per se, which is why I give it 4 stars. It's conveniently located in the Gaslamp, the beds are very comfortable, the entryway to the hotel is a MAGNIFICENT oversized door, the staff is friendly and efficient, etc. But... I stayed there for two nights with my boyfriend and the whole time we thought, "Dang. We wish we had booked at Palomar's beachier themed sister, Solamar". For me, Palomar is like that girl in the club who tries a bit too hard. She has one too many accessories on, a bit too much eyeliner, and you know by the end of the night she's going to be DYING to take off those stilettos. Solamar is more like your super cool friend who is always going on fun adventures and wants to take you with. Palomar has upscale styling, but it ends up looking like the upscale styling of every other upscale hotel. Solamar has a fresher approach to design, including very funky mirrors in the guest rooms. To me, Solamar feels effortless, approachable, and soothing. Palomar is very nice, but just not my speed. Note 1: The pool wasn't open while I was there (or at least I couldn't find a way to unlock the door to it). That was a bummer, because I love going out on Solamar's pool deck in the early morning and curling up with a good book as the sun climbs. Note 2: The guest rooms have fab wooden floors, which help alleviate my bed bug paranoia, but their heavy wood beds scratch the floors to pieces. Note 3: I do LOVE Palomar's rolling ottomans. I rolled back and forth all over the room in a frenzy just for fun. They roll REALLY quickly and the rooms have somewhat of a corridor inside that's a perfect rolling tract. I think a lot of travelers will prefer Palomar over Solamar, but if you're a more laid back beachier type of person with an eye for funkier design I suggest trying Solamar. In addition, their wine selection is always a bit more eclectic, which I like.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lenzer
Reviews.Content: The Palomar San Diego is a beautiful hotel (clean, modern, quiet, nice amenities). Our stay was lovely from the moment we walked in and the staff went above and beyond to help us with the area (neighborhood info, finding shops to buy a gift, restaurants, etc.). We would absolutely stay here again! Thank you Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “See Ya Se, Welcome Kimpton's Palomar”
Reviews.Author: Chaz B
Reviews.Content: Located in a great location on 5th. street in the Fun, Diverse, Energy filled Gas Lamp District of Downtown San Diego, the Palomar delivers a boutique gem with a modern hip feel. Wonderful staff, great amentities, and modern decor delivers a sophisticated, high end experiece in an area that has something for everyone. Its location at the end of 5th. street allows you to Stay and Sleep a few block up from the frantic up beat Gas Lamp experience. Go out the door, make a left and walk two block and you are in the middle of shopping, restaurants, bars, movie theatre, and street culture. Palomar's location is only outmatched my its professional, sincere staff providing genuine service... Can't wait to return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great addition to the Kimpton family!”
Reviews.Author: R B
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel in the San Diego area, I have stayed at the Kimpton sister hotel – Hotel Solamar - which I have always enjoyed. Had to try the new property when I had a couple of days in town. While it has only been part of the Kimpton family for a couple of months, from the moment of check in, the property and staff made it feel like all the other Kimpton hotels I have stayed in on both coasts. The valet noted a new service, whereby you can call up your vehicle via text message – very nice. The front desk recognized my Inner Circle membership and automatically upgraded my room (very stylish, as is the rest of the hotel). Kona, the fish, was provided in the room – always a nice touch away from home. My requested pillow option was already on the bed. The staff did all the things I have come to expect when arriving at a Kimpton property. The hotel is next door to the House of Blues (great music!) and very convenient to the airport, yet the room was completely quiet and relaxing, resulting in a great night's sleep. As others have noted, CVS and 7-11 are within a block of the hotel and convenient for late night snacks and missing toiletries. Great Gaslamp eateries and shopping are within easy walking distance. It was a beautiful weather, as always in SoCal, so a walk to the Marina Park was a perfect way to stretch the legs (great recommendation by the staff). At check out, the front desk staff was tied up, so the Concierage jump right in, checked me out quickly and made sure that my bill was emailed to me for my records (received before I got to the airport). Another great hotel in the Kimpton family, with gracious staff manning the front desk – can’t wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, but failed on the basics”
Reviews.Author: hobbrooks
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton hotels, and upon arrival, the Palomar in San Diego it looked to be completely up to par. Massive entry doors unlike anything I've ever seen, a gorgeous lobby and lobby bar, friendly check in staff, and a well appointed, modern, trendy room with a great view. I felt certain I would love this hotel as much as I have loved other Kimptons. I travel about 75 nights a year on business, and enjoy leisure travel with my wife as well. This trip was for a company meeting, and over 100 colleagues were staying there as well. I don't always expect that much out of a business hotel, but this proper missed on two major items. My TV consistently did not work, despite technical support being sent to my room multiple times to "fix" the problem. I also did not have hot water four out of my five morning showers. I don't mean the water wasn't steaming hot, nor even lukewarm or tepid - these showers were downright cold. Upon polling several of my colleagues, many if not most experienced the same problems with both the TV and hot water. It seems that this property may have overspent on appearance, but dropped the ball on some of the basics that would get me to come back. As a caveat, if you look at my other reviews, I am generally a very positive reviewer on trip advisor, not just a complainer with an axe to grind. Next time I am looking for a trendy hotel in San Diego, I think I will stick with the predictability of Starwood and stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “WOW does not even begin to describe this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndyMedic2006
Reviews.Content: I am not even sure where to begin with this review so lets start with the beginning. We were planning a short get away to San Diego and we have had very good luck with the Kimpton chain. So when I started to check out the San Diego area, i noticed that there were 2 Kimpton hotels in San Diego. I places a note on the Kimpton InTouch facebook page to reach out to others for some recommendations. I got one reply from a member of management at the Palomar. She asked me to email her my needs and wants and she came up with the perfect room suggestion for us. At Check-In, the desk staff and valet staff were attentive and friendly. When we got to our room, there was a complimentary bottle of wine left for us since they new we were they celebrating a milestone. The room had everything we could ask for and more. It was close to everything we wanted to go and see. The concierge recommended several nice places for us to have lunch and dinner. I can not say enough good things about the staff as they went out of their way for me several times during out stay. This is a definite 5 star hotel in my book!!!

Reviews.Title: “Efficient Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: hobsonga
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights over new year and had a great stay. A perfect location to stay for exploring San Diego and the surrounding area. The hotelis situated in downtown so literally there is an abundance of restaurants shops, malls on your doorstep. We used valey parking, not cheap at 48 dollars anight, but the system worked for us. There is a public car park right across the street, which gives you the alternative if you wish, althogh we dint even explore the cost of it. Bedrooms are simply but comfortably furnished and the floors are all wooden, beds are very, very good as are the bathrooms which are spacious and have a full bath and shower.The hotel has an excellent roof top pool, "HEATED", as wellas a good gym area which gives you the basic equipment for a workout, good by hotel standards....The bare seves great cocktails and seemed to be patronised by many locals which is always a good sign. Reception staff were fantastically efficient and friendly as were the bell hops and valets for parking. Gald we chose this hotel and a definate reccommend. The best restaurant we found was and Italian called ASTI, located on the same street, three blocks away on the left hand side. Italian food and servise at it's best. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in heart of Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: MichelleLMontreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my 3 other girlfriends. AT the time,, the hotel was called Se San Diego. We had a great experience. Rooms are very clean, modern and the bed is one of the most comfy bed i've ever slept in. We got a deal via travelzoo and only cost $99/night, which is a great deal. Location is great as well, right on the edge of Gaslamp district and easy walking distance to some nice restaurant, bars and clubs. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Palomar”
Reviews.Author: Great_tix
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the new year's weekend and had an amazing experience. The rooms are very modern and clean. The hotel staff was excellent. I will be returning! A+

Reviews.Title: “By Far the BEST place to stay in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Roadstraveledfar
Reviews.Content: Ok, I have little time in my life and never take the time to leave a review about a stay in a hotel. ( I stay in about 10 hotels a month ) but after reading "The Vegas Show Guy's " inaccurate review of The Palomar, I had to give my two cents! First some History on my stays- I originally found this place through a Hotwire purchase. It was "Hotel Se" at the time. I got in late and expected the typical treatment of how most hotels tend to treat Hotwire/Priceline guests ( Hotels tend to give those customers the least desirable rooms, by elevators, small or whatever ) well I was met by the Concierge and this night, he upgraded me to the most amazing room I have stayed in, in a long time. I was just your average guest, nothing special. When I left I felt like I had stayed at the Ritz and was addicted to this hotel. Upon my next visit, I learned the hotel had changed to a Kimpton property, my friendly Concierge had moved on, but I was met by a beaming front desk clerk named Nicole. Needless to say, Palomar had retained its great service in the transition. The restaurant was closed for renovation on this visit but I was excited to see it was going to be a upscale yet casual place that I would look forward to on my next visit. 3rd visit- ( Now a Palomar addict ) Nicole once again was at the desk, and this time Johnson came out to greet me and introduced himself as the Assistant Office ( front desk ) manager. He gave me his card and said if I needed anything to please contact him. Once again a PERFECT experience. ( Oh and this time the new addition to the staff was Kona the Goldfish! He does exist ) The Valet's at the Palomar are amazing- One night I got in late and had forgotten to remove my do not disturb sign on my room so housekeeping did not clean my room. I let him know at 10pm and he took care of it! By the time I was done with dinner and back in my room it was clean. And yes it is TRUE that the Valet gives you a card upon arrival with your car and lets you know to text when you need the car. It works and I loved the convenience! They are very clear about this policy so I do not know why Vegas guy would write that. Now let's talk about the SALTBOX- Love Love Love Erin! Full of life and a bevy of information. She makes one mean Martini! All of the staff in the bar have been amazing and as a Biz traveler I usually like to go somewhere other then the hotel to eat. Especially in the Gas Lamp. But you know what? I would not go anywhere else. The Sliders? - YUM, my favorite? The Lemon/Butter popcorn! ( Seriously ) Unfortunately I will not always be able to afford the Palomar, ( Our company has $$ Limitations ) but when I can, I will pick this first. It will be easy for some of you to think I work for this property, I assure you I do not. Feel free to contact me with your comments if you like. Hope all of you who get the chance to go to this property, enjoy it as much as I do. ( If you can afford it, you MUST book the Suites with the balcony and kitchen. You WILL NOT be disappointed! ( Final Note- This is kind of a hip trendy place. I am not sure it is the type of place that would appeal to the Senior set. If you are a Marriott Courtyard kind of person, or need a beach resort type place, this may not be for you! But if you like a lively nightlife, beautiful city views and GREAT GREAT SERVICE then you will be right at home at Palomar!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in the Gaslamp District !”
Reviews.Author: seabit
Reviews.Content: The Palomar San Diego is in the Gaslamp District of downtown, and what a treat to be so close to so many of San Diego's attractions ! We were able to walk to such places as the USS Midway, Seaport Village and the Harbor, not to mention all the great restaurants of the Gaslamp and Little Italy !! The Hotel Palomar is very modern and very comfortable ! All of the staff were excellent ! Each one very personable and overly helpful ! Heated pool, complimentary wine hour each evening, are great places to relax and mingle with others from all over !!

Reviews.Title: “Something Fishy going on...”
Reviews.Author: VegasShowGuy
Reviews.Content: The reviews seem to be loaded with items as if an advertisement by the hotel. E.g. Comments that guests asked for a fish, Kona, in their room ( dont seem that mentioned anywhere on site or by staff). Reviews mention texting valet to get car. Again, we were never advised of such conveniences. Unfortunately our experiences were negative aside from the Saltbox restaurant ( in separate review), which we enjoyed immensely. Just stayed in 2 rooms for 3 nights ( 1 senior, 3 adults, 2 kids = 6 people ). Booked it through Expedia on their "unpublished hotel" facility. Not a good idea. For us at least. This is the old Hotwire Co they acquired. You choose a general area and grade of hotel, pay upfront and then get advised of hotel you will stay at. So, we chose downtown san diego, 4.5 star. What could go wrong with a 4.5 star hotel in San Diego? For approx $170 p.night p.room with taxes. Not the cheapest, but, wow it was going to be 4.5 star. Then the fun started... We were advised via email that the hotel was the kimpton in gaslamp quarter. Having lived in San Francisco and stayed at kimptons there, we were happy as they have a good reputation there. As a safeguard, Immediately after I booked with expedia, I called the property directly to request that the rooms we purchased have 2 beds each as we were a party of 6. Hotel advised that they do not allow any requests for bookings coming from expedia/hotwire as the room rate they get is so low that we get "run of house" or whats left basically and that the room rate was less than an employee rate. ( not my problem - sorry - kimptons business decision ). So from the get go, it felt like were second rate citizens. It turns out that Kimpton only acquired this property, formerly Ce ce) approx 3 months ago and was desperately trying to fill rooms at any cost and ignoring the star rating. So, I asked was the hotel full or what the likelihood of getting rooms with 2 beds would be. They said they had 3 rooms with 2 beds left and that to guarantee we get them, we could upgrade for $20 per room per night. I was reluctant as I now felt like I'd been taken. I asked how they expected 6 people to sleep in 2 beds. Answer: the rooms are fire coded for 4 people irrespective of number of beds. Not the answer I was looking for. The conversation was clearly going nowhere. Not 4.5 star service. No other suggestions. I said I'd call expedia and get back. Called expedia. Spoke with phillipino person who spent forever looking up "terms of conditions" of my purchase. Said she would refer to supervisor. Got cut off. I called back. Spoke to another agent, who said the notes in the booking said, " no guarantees of bed arrangement and that was it '. I then suggested they call hotel to request rooms with 2 beds on our behalf as they should have more "clout" or to change us to another 4.5 star hotel in the San Diego area. They used the standard, empathize and restate guidelines and said, " I'm sorry sir, I do understand sir, but we cannot call hotel and we cannot change the hotel". I stated that I could call my credit card company and cancel the transaction for misrepresentation, then, I would be happy to book with expedia again in a property that would guarantee 2 beds in each room ( not too much to ask is it? ). I was told I couldn't do that per their terms. Solution came when a manager got on the line and advised to go ahead and pay the upgrade to hotel and fax receipt to expedia for a refund. I haven't done that yet. The property its self seems like its in flux. Several different staff inconsistences. I felt sorry for the front desk girls. There is a need for consistent training. Eg. Called hotel phone. "Do you have towels we can take to beach?" . "Yes you can take the green towels from the pool". Went to pool. No staff. No towels. went to front desk. "Where are beach towels please"?. Answer. "Sorry you cant take towels to beach". "Oh, I just spoke with housekeeping on phone and they advise it was ok. I went to pool and couldnt see anybody or any towels. None on view anywhere.". "Oh, ok, that was probably the manager who was trying to be nice and helpful". gal said. ". "Great, so where are they?". There are purple towels at the back around the corner of the pool". I went. Low and behold. WHITE TOWELS (just like ones in room). Oy Vey. This was to get a towels. No fridges. (Locked minibars only). Nice wood panel floors, but heavy , deep, scratches by side table and bed. No coffee makers. Weak chocolate and coffee in lobby in am. Parking is valet only. $36 per day. (thats pricey). Valet guy was helpful with directions. No real views to speak of. Parking garage (rm 604). Back of house, vents, etc(rm901). Errors on bill. Got charged for 2 cars, 3 nights. Only used valet 1 night with 1 car. Bed sheets were clean and comfy, however, beds were small ( double beds ). ok for 1 person only. Rooms somewhat clean. "Dust/Fluff bunnies" in room on floor. Shampoo and conditioner seemed poor quality. No lotion. "Free" in room wifi required providing email and info for their mailing list. Location on fringe of great gaslamp quarter and uglier area with "street people". Intimidating for kids. Overall. Better choices available. Dont recommend using "hotwire" method of buying high rated room and finding out later where you get. Not really a family hotel. Restaurant, Saltbox. Very Good. As we checked in, another customer with a family, was asking for a room with 2 beds as he had booked with hotwire/expedia and received room with 1 bed. Front desk couldnt help and offered him more blankets for family to sleep on floor. I'm pleased I called ahead and paid "upgrade" for 2 beds. Now all I have to do is see if expedia will refund upgrade fee they promised to. The city of San diego is overall very interesting, diverse, great climate and has alot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: KayDenmark
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here - the reception staff was particularly helpful - but what really made a difference was the sensational restaurant, The Saltbox. We had a couple of great breakfasts there - the banana and ricotta pancakes were especially good - and a great lunch. Much better than some of the mediocre restaurants in the Gaslamp Quarter down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, great location”
Reviews.Author: nonrevver
Reviews.Content: We got a king suite and it had a cool wrap around balcony. Hotel was very nice and the rooms were large with a huge master bathroom. Great location in the Gaslamp that's walkable to a bunch of nice restaurants, shopping, bars, waterfront area. If you're looking for location, there are a bunch of hotels nearby that are probably cheaper, but not nearly as nice. They have a trendy restaurant, The Saltbox, attached to the hotel which had pretty good food and seems to be frequented by locals as well as guests. It's also adjacent to the House Of Blues which plays a lot of loud music. The walls and windows are well sound isolated, but if you step out on the balcony it's like a free nightclub experience. Parking must be expensive in that area of San Diego. They charge $36 for valet parking, but there's a garage across the street that's still $28. You actually might as well go with the valet even though that price sounds ludicrous. They give you a number you can text when you want to get your car so it'll be waiting for you. It's a nice idea, but the time we used it it didnt really work out and we still had to wait. Overall, the hotel is great for people who want to be in an active, trendy environment, with access to the Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “"Going back to Cali"”
Reviews.Author: lcostin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went to California. We use to lived in the San Diego area 10 years ago. All I can say is great memories, great views, great service and great hotel. We spent half the week in Northern California, drove down the pacific coast highway and spent the second half of our trip in San Diego at the Palomar. Wow what a hotel. From the chic oversized rotating door upon entry to the modish roof top heated pool, the Palomar is definitely a swanky joint. I highly reccomend reserving one of the skilyine flats. The flats are spacious and have a feel of coming home to an urban loft. The hotel is centrally located to zoo, ball park and trolley and is very kid friendly. It also sits in the heart of the Gaslamp area. If you haven't tried Kimpton....add it to your list of things to do in 2012. Happy New Years! Lisa ps. many thanks to the valets, front desk staff and managers for making us feel like very special guests.

Reviews.Title: “Gaslamp Chic”
Reviews.Author: clutchbomb
Reviews.Content: This property (formerly Se Hotel) is one of the very best in San Diego. Luxurious, chic, trendy- a personal favorite of mine. The rooftop pool deck and bar makes this hotel great, but the service and rooms/decor/balconies are incomparable. Location is next to House of Blues in the Gaslamp, however a few blocks away from the historic part of the Gaslamp. I have read about the location not being great- it's literally 2 blocks away from the main center and the outdoor shops- hardly something to complain about! I haven't tried the new restaurant, but heard it's a step up from the prior restaurant in terms of better pricing/food variety.

Reviews.Title: “City chic”
Reviews.Author: mewerner
Reviews.Content: Great bed, small but efficient room. Asked for a quiet location, as the hotel is next to the House of Blues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: patspaws
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this property and, like all Kimptons, the service was top-rate. You actually get the sense that employees enjoy working their, and that translates to a welcoming experience for guests. If you're a Kimpton loyalist, you know that each property has a different, albeit modern, feel. The decor of this property tends toward the Zen, but that's not to suggest that the furnishings are sparse. To the contrary, the rooms are quite comfortable, the bathrooms well-equiped, and the plush robes are a real treat. Palomar is a few blocks further from the convention center than Kimpton's other property, Solimar, but still an easy walk of maybe six blocks through the Gas Lamp District. As for dining, you can avoid the touristed and mediocre restaurants in the Gas Lamp in favor of the hotel's Salt Box Restaurant. Hands down, my best meals were at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: eddiemfbina209
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference. The hotel staff from the front desk, lounge/bar, door greeters/bellmen, chauffeur, and restaurant staff provided exceptional service. The room was modern decor, fee wi-fi was fast, great location, and the catered food was phenomenal. Definitely a place to stay if you love great service.

Reviews.Title: “Uber Chic...First Class”
Reviews.Author: ShopDiva
Reviews.Content: From the moment we've arrived until check-out, the Palomar San Diego was first class all the way. We loved the modern decor, the entire staff was friendly and willing to please, the complimentary wine hour was perfect, and our room was comfortable. The over-all feel of the room was "zen", complete with the rain shower bathroom. They made our "girls night on the town" a very special one. Some hotels don't understand the power of superior customer service and should learn a thing or two from the Palomar staff. We will definitely book this hotel whenever we stay in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “"Treat yourself to the very best..."”
Reviews.Content: If your goal is to treat yourself to the very best of hotel experiences stay at the Palomar San Diego.My experience was outstanding from the moment I rang Kimpton resevations and got a reservation agent that was friendly and eager to make my stay in San Diego memorable.Every request I made was honored.Upon arrival at the Palomar San Diego ,I was welcomed as a valued and appreciated guest.The entire staff had a "can do" attitude and every request I made was honored with enthusiasm.The hotel has outstanding ameneties.I had the pleasure of dining at the Palomar restaurant several times and the food was just outstanding and a good value.Visit the pool and downstairs bar...both facilities are sure to be memorable!For value,service and a memorable stay treat yourself to this Kimpton Hotel in San Diego.You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nomadgal
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of the Kimpton Hotels and the Palomar did not disappoint. Very cool lobby where they have free happy hour drinks and live music in the evening. The basic deluxe room is spacious with nice, dark wood floors, comfortable beds, and a rainshower bathroom. Reception staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. The hotel location is perfect, right in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter and walking distance to Horton Plaza mall and plenty of restaurants and shops. We enjoyed our stay and wished we could stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “A 1st Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pdwarren
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Palomar for 8 days, during the America's Cup sailing regatta, in mid-November2011. The staff advised that the property is newly-renovated and even more newly-opened. Remarkable since the staff seemed to be running at "top performance," with no signs of a "break-in" period with minor hiccups. The front desk staff was courteous and efficient. Their friendly "hello's" when we returned from dinner each night made us feel very welcome and appreciated. The complimentary wine get together for guests is a nice touch, but the wine selections need to be upgraded just a bit, especially when you're that close to so many boutique wineries. I'd think that local wineries (e.g., Temecula) would love to expose their wines to Palomar guests. The Palomar is conveniently located in the Gaslamp District. Walking to most restaurants and attractions was easy. On our first night (late arrival), the front desk manager recommended the "Yard House", just around the corner. The menu options were almost too many and the food was great; note: it's a sports bar, so the ambiance is "noisy." This was our first stay at a Kimpton hotel, but won't be the last. We're hooked, thanks to a recommendation from a business colleague.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: 1Kamilah
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in one of their conods for my 28th Bday and I received the best service ever!! The exquisite treatment first started when I sopke with the reservation specialist Tori. She really understood that I wanted it to be special and made excellent suggestions and recommended what room type would suit my needs. Once I checked in, Natalie and Astrid worked the front desk and they were both awesome ensuring all details and requests were handled in a professional and timely manner. I would definately recommend this hotel!!! Thank you Tori, Astrid, Natalie :-)

Reviews.Title: “Palomar (formerly Se)- Fun Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lenals
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a trip for my HS reunion and loved it! It was right in the middle of the gaslamp district. We booked a Travelzoo deal and were able to upgrade to a suite for a great price. I read the reviews before we went and most of the negatives were that it was a "party hotel". Since we were going for my reunion (without our kids) that didn't bother me. We wanted something fun and close to where we were going. The suite was fabulous! Decor was great and it overlooked the rooftop pool (which turned into a nightclub). It was loud in the evening and at night but we didn't mind since we went to the club and had a great time. If you are going for a quiet, family stay I would not recommend this hotel but if you want something in the heart of the gaslamp district that is fun, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Betticat
Reviews.Content: We went down to San Diego for a weekend getaway/birthday celebration. I picked this place as they did receive fairly good ratings and it looked clean with some moody lighting inside; I like that! Anyway, the upsides of this place are obvious as are the downsides. Upside: great service, rooms, amenities, and location. Nothing felt like they were cutting corners on anything, they provided some great robes to use during the stay, and the best part, friendly staff. Downside: there is some crazy club poolside on the weekends that blasts music late in to the night, penetrating every square inch of the room, and we were on the 14th floor. I sleep like a log, and we got in late, so I was fine. My boyfriend on the other hand requested some earplugs from the front desk and they were promptly sent to the room. They even pumped the jams in the rain when there was little or no one there. Trust me, I could look through the glass roof and directly down to the pool/club. The view is spectacular and if your intention is to enjoy the nightlife of the city and get in late, you will be fine. Otherwise, I would recommend a room on the opposite side of the pool. Additionally, you will feel raked over the coals with the valet parking, but parking in general is a bear in downtown, so you would be hard pressed to do any better unless you choose to find parking yourself and don't mind waking up at 3-5 a.m. in the morning to move your car. Last but not least, they have that typical cable package that always have a overwhelming amount of ESPN channels yet no Bravo. What? We are in California. Long story short, I would still stay here again in a minute, I would just be smarter about it. Get a room in the back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: NyBesa
Reviews.Content: I love Kimptons and had great experiences until staying here. The coupe de gras was they neglected to provide neither my wake up call nor the back up wake up call. Kimpton has only had this property for about a month. They have a ton of work to do. Other issues - no drinking glasses in the room, we called to ask for some and instead they brought ice. They didn't have a selection of towels in the bathroom, and didn't deliver the proper paper the first day, delivered papers late the 2nd day. Overall, they just don't have it all together yet. I could have spent less, had a wakeup call, etc. etc. When I told the mgr about my lack of wakeup call, she apologized, but didn't seem to think it was such a big deal. Also, would recommend staying on a high floor and not near the elevator. They put us on the 3rd floor - street noise all night long and the dinging of the elevator outside our door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views, cool location”
Reviews.Author: Brian G
Reviews.Content: Very close to the busy bar night life. Room had great views of the downtown with sightings of the harbor between the buildings. Great service. Short cab ride/drive to beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Already looking to return!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy Z
Reviews.Content: With so many options in SD, we selected Palomar for a friends birthday celebration over a long weekend! What a perfect choice - modern yet zen feeling, such a welcoming front desk/ bellman staff and discovered a fun atmosphere at the poolside. We had a corner suite which made us blown away when we entered the room and saw the views of the City. The location is right in the gaslamp district with great restuarants & very central.
