We are all already thinking about repeating this trip next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation spot for whatever you are looking for...”
Reviews.Author: Jillian L
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing experience staying at this hotel. The location was central, the staff top-notch, and the rooms and grounds top quality. With all of that, it didn't feel pretentious. It still kept the style and feel of Southern California, therefore it provided relaxation and nightlife all in one. I most definitely look forward to staying there again, and have recommended this to friends, family and co-workers a like.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Kimpton experience!!”
Reviews.Author: MiniG3
Reviews.Content: Staying at a Kimpton hotel has become a fall tradition for my friend and I to escape the stresses of everyday life. We absolutely love the service, attention to detail and the decor at the Kimptons. The staff are so kind, helpful and friendly...they really make an effort to get to know their guests! Love the morning coffee and evening wine service too. Unfortunately, the weather was not the best so we were not able to enjoy the rooftop pool and bar lounge but the hotel location is ideal if you would enjoy going to the many restaurants, bars and pubs in the Gaslamp District. Look forward to our next Kimpton adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay-Cation!”
Reviews.Author: JinSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were desperate for a "stay-cation" getaway here in San Diego. Two kids under 7 and no time away from them later.... we finally decided an overnight San Diego Downtown Stay-Cation was just what we needed. We chose downtown San Diego because we love Candellas restaurant on 3rd and J Street, so, we thought - hey, we can enjoy a leisurely at our favorite restaurant and not have to rush back to the baby sitter (like always!) Then, besides our plan to have a fantastic dinner, we decided to stay at a hotel with a beautiful view so we could really feel like we were on vacation. We were very fortunate to book a fantastic room on the 19th floor of Hotel Palomar. The view was stunning and the room was so beautiful. The front desk was very helpful with suggestions about what to see within walking distance. We went over to Seaport Village (just a 20 minute walk) and enjoyed a beautiful waterfront stroll. The hotel had many amenities such as free wine from 4 - 5pm and an Escalade that drove us to the restaurant. We really liked that. The personal Keurig coffee / tea maker in the room was a fun treat for us too. We didn't buy wine while out on the town, but, if we did, our room had a temp controlled wine fridge. : ) Even the bathroom was lovely with a TV in the mirror - I put it on a music channel while we were getting ready to go out to dinner. We didn't need anything extra, but, there was a sign in the bathroom that said if we forgot anything, they would get it for us -- even if it was not the regular stuff, like a toothbrush. I had never heard of a hotel that would do that. Good to know for future reference. There was a flat screen TV in both the "living room" area and the bedroom too. The room service breakfast we ordered was right on time with the estimate they gave us and the presentation was lovely. Yummy eggs benedict. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gary L
Reviews.Content: My wife and 14 yr old daughter recently stayed at this hotel after spending 4 nights in Vegas for my 50th birthday present, it was the perfect place to relax after Vegas. The hotel staff was so friendly and very accomodating, on arrival our room was without a safe the hotel receptionist had one located and put in our room with in an hour. The first night we found our room was experienceing some noise from the main street so they moved us immediatley. The guest rooms were well appointed and the bar.lounge and pool area were very nice, again all the staff were very friendly. We chose the perfect hotel in the San Diego for our visit. I would highly recomend anyone traveling to San Diego for the first time to stay with this hotel as its location was right in the heart of the restaurent area and with the expert guidence of the concierge you can't go wrong. A big thank you to all at The Palomar

Reviews.Title: “Great Gaslamp Quarter Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina M
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton's! Visiting San Diego for the 1st time, and my favorite hotel company has two in this city. The Palomar was beautiful, right in the Gaslamp. Restaurants, bars, shops, all in the area. Hotel has a pool - fun! Bar was great, yummy creative drinks!! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SWDerrick
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel prior to my cruise vacation out of San Diego. The hotel staff was so friendly and accomodating. I had last minute items I needed before my vacation. The hotel staff helped me prioritize my list and showed me exactly where to go and everything was within walking distance. The guest rooms were well appointed and the bar/lounge area was so trendy. I could not have picked a better hotel in the San Diego market. I would highly encourage anyone traveling to San Diego to stay with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BEST IN SAN DIEGO”
Reviews.Author: CGArcher
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in San Diego - the service is excellent and the views from the high floors are amazing. Friendly, Caring and Attentive Staff. I loved being right down town to view the city lights and enjoy just short walks to restaurants and bars. This will be the only place I'll stay when I visit San Diego again. Very impressed with everything...

Reviews.Title: “There's a new Kimpton in town.”
Reviews.Author: cabogolf19
Reviews.Content: The Palomar, San Diego has arrived….almost. I can say without hesitation that every contact I had with hotel staff was superb. Valet, bellstaff, front-desk, wait staff, all great. You should also know that I am a regular guest at the Solamar, the other San Diego Kimpton. As an inner circle member I always hope, but never expect that I will be upgraded. This time I received a wonderful upgrade to a Flat on the 19th floor. I had 1,000 square feet just for me. I’ve never stayed in a Kimpton with a full-kitchen, dishwasher included (not that I was going to use it). It had a nice living/kitchen area, a large dining room table, a bedroom with a large walk in closet and 1.5 baths. Did I mention the balcony with the beautiful view of Downtown San Diego…. At the risk of sounding ungrateful, there are a few things that need to fine-tuned at the Palomar. -Housekeeping of my particular room. The carpet in the living room was stained, really stained. It needs to be shampooed and soon. In addition, the previous guest left several items of trash in the drawers of the walk-in closet. From the receipts that were left behind and the boxes, it must have been a really wild time. When as a guest you find these things, it makes you wonder…what else isn’t clean. -The bathroom. There are absolutely no, we’re talking zero towel racks/hooks. Strange for a hotel chain that prides itself on reduce/reuse. -Window coverings/drapes. There are zero blinds/drapes/window coverings in the living room/kitchen/dining area which is fine. Just be mindful that you are in full-public view. The window coverings in the bedroom are poor. If you are bothered by light, you will be very unhappy. I travel with a sleep-mask and earplugs, so I was fine. Overall, I’ll give it a B and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Does It Again - Great Stay at Palomar!”
Reviews.Author: DdHolyoak
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Palomar the last weekend of September for a birthday celebration - we loved every minute of it. We've stayed at many Kimpton Hotels over the years (in DC, New York, Chicago and Seattle) because of their style and their support of the LGBT community. The Palomar in San Diego doesn't disappoint - they have the fun amenities like wine hour (yum!) and free coffee in the lobby (much needed). Also, we love to travel with our two Jack Russell terriers, and since Kimpton Hotels are pet friendly, we were able to make it a "family" vacation. We were in a gorgeous King Suite that had lots of space for us to spread out. The bathroom was HUGE and had jacuzzi tub and all-glass shower. Chuck and Astrid at the front desk were great with local reccomendations for dining and entertainment. We tried the new restaurant, Saltbox, for dinner and drinks one night. In true form, it was also amazing! The cocktail list was insane! If you're ever at the bar, ask for Erin to make you one of her special cocktails! The hotel also a beautiful pool area, but since we had plans with friends, we didn't get to enjoy the pool. Overall, a great experience and another feather in hat for Kimpton!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Property with Top Notch Service to Match”
Reviews.Author: Teresa M
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and have always been a fan of Kimpton Hotels... when I heard a Palomar was opening in San Diego, it was the perfect excuse to take a weekend getaway out of LA. And...I was not disappointed. From the moment my friend and I arrived it was 5-star all the way. The valets and doorman were great - and very helpful with directions when we needed them throughout our stay. Check-in was seamless...there were a few guests in line ahead of us, and the front desk staff made sure to acknowledge us immediately. They were professional and friendly- greeted us with smiles every time we left and came back. The room...AMAZING! Gorgeous and comfortable with huge windows and great views. Although I never saw the housekeeping staff, whenever we got back to the room it was as if we were checking in all over again...I wish that happened every time I left my house!! In addition to the staff and service, the location is great too. Several places in walking distance and very easy freeway access. Palomar gets 5-stars from me...if you haven't stayed at this property, I definitely recommend you do...you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claire G
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop on our honeymoon. The staff were very nice, they even upgraded us to a Sky view King Suite. The room was amazing, the beds so comfy, and the view was great. The food at this hotel is also gorgeous. We got room service one night and it was the best I have ever had! Great downtown location in the Gaslamp quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Hotel - Stop 9”
Reviews.Author: Fats25
Reviews.Content: San Diego is excellent - a really lively town, far livelier than we anticipated. What we wanted from a hotel in San Diego was a hotel with a roof pool, in the Gaslamp district. The flights for UK leave San Diego late in the evening, so we thought we could have a day chilling out by the pool, before leaving in the evening to catch our flight. Prior to leaving UK we decided that we were going to stay in the Hotel Solamar (bear with me here!), and I was supposed to book it after checking with my wife it was the hotel we wanted. A couple of days before leaving I realized I had forgotten to book it, and the price had jumped by about 30% - so I decided to leave it and gamble we would find somewhere either when we arrived, and I would keep an eye on websites for deals. About a week before we arrived I checked Expedia and found the Solamar hotel, for the original price we had been looking at. At least I thought I had! I had actually booked the Palomar. After some e-mail checking to ensure we had booked the correct hotel (there is also a Palomar in San Fran I believe) we arrived at the Palomar. First thing we found was there was no car park. I'm not a fan of valet parking, as I am more than capable of parking a car, however the guys were very helpful with the parking, and gave me directions to the car park they use, and I managed to get 2 nights and 3 days (Thurs, Fri and Sat) for $30 pre paid - multiple entry. Check-in was very pleasant, and we were well looked after. The room was large, well decorated, free wi-fi, and clean. Looked like it had recently been decorated. The whole hotel was very, very nice, and in a great location for Gaslamp district. 2nd Kimpton on our trip, and very impressed. Knowing we would be checking out at lunchtime and sitting round the pool all day, we asked about access to somewhere to shower before we left and were told they would check with the Spa to see if we could use this, when we came to check out. On the Friday afternoon we went and sat by the pool, had a couple of drinks and relaxed. Perfect for what we wanted the following day. Unfortunately what we had not accounted for was that Saturday is obviously posing day by the pool. Lots of drunk, loud showy off people. Not the hotels fault - it was just the clientele that were there that day. So not as relaxing as we hoped, and only a small part of the pool area was in the Sun so we had to fight for a spot. Pool is nice though, and bar staff very welcoming. When we came to leave we were given access to the Spa to take a shower before we left. All in all I would probably give this place a 4.5 if there was a rating, but due to the staff helpfulness there (Valet guys giving their information for car park, and Nicole on reception for all of her assistance with Spa access, and other stupid questions I had!) - I will push the rating to a 5. Will definitely seek out Kimpton hotels as our chain of choice when in the US in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel with great service and all facilities we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: dg252
Reviews.Content: We had a great suite. Service was great - eg we asked at the front desk for some hot water to make tea, it arrived only a couple minutes after we'd got up to our room. Staff weren't entirely knowledgeable on the area (got a supermarket location a block out) but wouldn't hold that against them! When we left we asked them to call a cab for us, they brought round the courtesy car to drive us to the airport for free instead! As an Inner Circle member we got all the snacks and treats we had asked for. All in all, it was just fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing”
Reviews.Author: dima1976
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Holiday Inn on business, I've spent the weekend at the Hotel Palomar. Without a doubt, this is an incredibly gorgeous and brand-new property. Our room, 307, had floor-to-ceiling wall-to-wall window, the bathroom was simply out of this world, and the size of the room with its sparse furnishings made it seem larger than it was. The only suggestion would be to add dining tables and chairs to the rooms. Everything else, including the staff, were just fantastic. I will be definitely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel in the Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: KLGri
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel when it was Se San Diego, and I have to say that it has improved since becoming a Kimpton property. The front desk staff was polite and helpful (although perhaps not quite as well-versed in the different restaurants in the area as they could be). The rooms are clean and quiet, although I did see the same piece of tomato on the floor outside the elevators for 2 days. The hotel restaurant, the Saltbox, is very good - again with a great waitstaff. And as I was there for a meeting, and we were using the catering for breakfast, breaks, and dinner, I can say that all of that food was a cut above the usual banquet offerings. The real downside to this hotel is that there are no coffeemakers in the rooms. It might seem like a little thing, but going down to the lobby to get coffee first thing in the morning is not how I like to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: sardub243
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to SD on business and didn't know anyone in the city. My 1st night there, the hostess and bartender made me feel very welcome. The rooms are awesome- sleek, modern, spacious. I signed out a bike and cruised around the city- the valet and concierge staff were all very helpful. Yes, it was a little loud on the street and the pool area on Friday night, but it didnt really bother me at all, like I see it had the other commentors- perhaps because I am a New Yorker! Unfortunately, I came down with flu-like symptoms and EVERYONE from security, to front desk to housekeeping to the restaurant staff were so helpful and courteous and just downright sweet! I was so pleasantly surprised by this :) I will be returning to this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't keep their promises”
Reviews.Author: MaxnKel
Reviews.Content: I booked a room over a month in advance, through a travel website. When I arrived at the Se to check in, I was handed a letter, and told that I was staying in another hotel quite a distance away. They said that the travel website had overbooked them. I find it very hard to believe that when I made my reservation over a month prior that they had no availability, as my reservation was confirmed. I specifically booked at the Se for the location, on 5th near all entertainment and dining. I had plans to meet friends at a restaurant right down the street for dinner. The hotel I was redirected to did not have any restaurants open at night, and there were not any bars/nightclubs nearby. Basically it was near nothing in the way of dining/entertainment. So, we ended up having to pay for a cab to go out to dinner, when we could have just walked up the street if the Se had honored my reservation. The front desk people could not have been less concerned about the inconvenience that this switch caused me. The Se should not participate with outside booking sites if they do not plan to honor their commitment. Shady business in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service saved the day!!”
Reviews.Author: susang060
Reviews.Content: I was very reluctant to stay in the Se based on some trip advisor reviews, but since my boyfriend chose the hotel, I was determined to make the best of it. VERY COOL VIBE at check in...when they mentioned that they had just been bought by Klimpton, I knew all would be well....the Klimpton Group is rapidly becoming my favorite chain. Our first room was small, but doable...until it became apparent that the AC was problematic. They were very attentive, yet we had a sleepless night...they could not correct the problem. In a customer service industry myself, it's how problems are resolved that gets the grades. Chuck and the staff were exemplorary!!! He moved us to the finest accomodation available...and helped send us out to one of the best breakfasts ever while he made the arrangements. After a good night's rest in our new quarters, he painstakingly plotted out a day and directions for the quintessential San Diego experience. This is a place to watch!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...worst service... Loud pool party at night that prevents you from sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: traveling_jenni
Reviews.Content: As my boyfriend and I are sitting in the hallway after a full day of kayaking... He finally exclaimed that this is the worst hotel experience ever. I agree. This was my bday present to him as well so I feel really bad. I am writing this review while laying in bed at 11 pm at night on the 7th floor that feels like I am in the middle of a club from the pool party downstairs. Why were we in the hallway at 10:30pm? The cleaning lady didn't clean our room. Also our first night upon arrival... No glasses or cups in the room. First time ever this has happened. At breakfast, there was not a hostess and we sat ourselves waiting for five minutes. We left. This is a shame bc the hotel is part of a luxury hotel collection... We stayed at ojai resort last week which is the same group and we left exclaiming how wonderful the service was. I got this hotel on a travelzoo deal and at half the price, it was not worth it. If i paid the full $200+/night deal... I would even be more livid. This experience is pretty horrible and a waste of a weekend...and especially a special one at that. Pls stay away as far away as you can.

Reviews.Title: “2 sides to the Se”
Reviews.Author: jsvanthoff
Reviews.Content: One side: Modern, elegant, sleak. Great valet, so kind and helpful. Great concierge, comfortable beds, large bright windows in the rooms, wine tasting, great location. Other side: Expensive, poor housekeeping (we needed to call down often to get coffe cups, glasses, ect.) shower water splashed everywhere, bathroom door does not provide privacy to my desire. Charge for WiFI in the room, "Jersey Shore" pool parties that overflow to ALL other parts of the hotel, elitism from front desk staff (we were not to their standards, we are from Wisconsin), websites information is not accurate. All said. A nice trip if you can laugh off some of the others. Won't stay again. Will pay the same price to try something different that is hopefully ALL that was promised.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: SMC0108
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I live in north SD county, but saw a deal for the Se boutique hotel in downtown and jumped on it. The room was small but beautiful and comfortable. We were only staying for one night and didn't bring that much stuff, so the size was not an issue for us. There was a free wine tasting in the lobby in the evening, which was a great surprise. The bar downstairs, Suite & Tender, is also a nice place to relax and get a drink or a small dinner. We met up with some friends and had some great food there. We also went to the spa inside the hotel, which I believe was overpriced. The service was great and the facilities are beautiful, but I've had as good or better for much less money in the past. Overall we had a great experience and would definitely recommend the Se to anyone coming to SD.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica V
Reviews.Content: I was highly disappointed by this hotel. They may say they are a 4 star hotel. They are far from it. Valet is $36 a day, which is fine, if they did their job well. If I have to pay for this service, I expect to have my bags put in the car and the door opened for me. Instead, I was handed the keys and the gentleman said "see ya later.." Also, we left $200 sunglasses in the car, since the only time we use them when we drive, and they are now missing. We stayed at this hotel because my fiance just came home from a very long deployment. I called in advanced to see if I could set up the room for our romantic get-a-way. I was told no. They would not help me at all with any of my ideas. (I work in a very popular hotel on Miami Beach, I know customer service, and I received none.) Once we got into our room, we were shocked by our "beautiful city view". It was a view of a parking garage and a tall building. Also, when we wanted to take a shower, there was no hot water. When I called down, they said, "we're working on it, you can come down to the spa to take a shower if you would like." I wish they would have told this when we checked in. The last thing that bothered me was the fact that we had to listen to the music playing until 2 am (we had no problem with it, since we figured we would be there). However, we got back from dinner and drinks pretty late and wanted to join the pool party around 12:45am, we were told we could not. I said we were guest of the hotel and we would like to have a drink here in the hotel. The lady at the counter said only people that were allowed in were the ones that were here earlier in the night. So instead we went to the room and had to listen to the party that we could not par take in. The decor and the bed were nice but I would never tell a friend and family to stay at this hotel. I am very sadden by the fact that my fiance, who just got home from a long, stressful deployment did not have a better stay. I wanted to do something very nice at a classy hotel, and sadly, I choose this hotel. Please don't do the same mistake I did! Take your money and memories to a better place!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, new, and a party on the weekends”
Reviews.Author: Arthur B
Reviews.Content: Quick background - I'm 24, single, from Chicago and love to party. The hotel is very nice, uber modern as you can see from the pics. We were upgraded to a room on the 8th floor w/ a balcony overlooking the pool/nightclub (on the 4th floor below). The balcony was awesome as we were there to party and it was cool to hang out over the club. However, beware the noise level is very loud until 2am (weekends). I would imagine this is true for all pool side rooms up to the 12-14th floors and higher. The staff is very good at attempting to make guest aware of this at check-in and provide quieter accommodations if possible. The rooms are very small (and ours was one of the larger ones). Bathrooms are designed with a glass sliding door that will offer NO privacy. Just beware - you will be very close to whomever you are sharing the room with. The shower is non-traditional w/ a rain-type shower and no door so it gets water on the bathroom floor and can get cold in the shower. The service is decent at best - not what you would expect from a 4-star hotel. The staff seems to be preoccupied with running the club on weekend nights and it gets very crowded in the lobby and elevators at night (weekend) because of the club. Overall, for me the hotel was fun, very cool (different than the typical Westin catering to the business traveler). Beware of the above warnings as anyone expecting some of the typical features of a 4-star hotel (quiet, privacy, excellent service) will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Something new”
Reviews.Author: arthura1
Reviews.Content: It was my first stay at this hotel. It was very enjoyable. The staff was very great and helpull.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa P
Reviews.Content: We just spent a night in San Diego, a nice weekend getaway. It's perfectly located in the Gaslamp District - on 5th Ave near all the restaurants and a few blocks from the water. The hotel was great. The staff were very helpful, even suggesting an inexpensive place for a pedicure when the spa was booked, Upon checkin, the front desk let us know that there was a late night pool party and asked if we would prefer a quiet room - a nice touch. However, we did find the hallway to be very noisy- you could hear everything. Luckily there were only 5 or 6 rooms in the wing so while it was noisy when someone walked in or out of their room, it didn't happen often. The beds are so comfortable and the room, while a bit small, was very nice. The one problem - the shower. There was no door or curtain so it was cold and flooded the bathroom. And the gym was great - had one of the best hotel workouts! Overall - great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with our choice! Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: SDSpartan
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on a room here $99 through Travel Zoo, which included some extras, a drink each and $25 room credit. We both work downtown but had never been to this hotel and were looking for a way to celebrate our anniversary. Well, we loved it. Can't wait to return. The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The lobby has this great big door - have to see it to imagine it. Pretty cool. Pretty minimal decor, making it seem tranquil. They have just become a Kimpton property - so don't know how that will affect things. Anyway, the room was on the 14th floor overlooking the pool side - ask for a room as far up as you can get since they have DJ music @ the pool until about 1:30 p.m. - so it may be noisy if you are closer to the pool. The room has lovely wood (or laminate) flooring in a dark color - there was a large window which actually opens. We had nice views, even could we Pt Loma and the Harbor. The room is a bit small, but worked for the two of us. The bed was amazing! So comfortable, I didn't want to leave. They have nice linens - 400 sheet count I believe. A nice duvet comfortable. A flat screen TV. There's a Keurig coffee maker, but it was in the closet - odd. Had to take it out and put it on the desk to work it. The bathroom had a tiled shower with a rain shower head - which had good pressure - it was very nice. The bathroom itself was a good size and could easily accommodate 2 people getting ready at the same time. The hotel offers a complimentary wine hour from 5 to 6 - that was very nice. The pool area is great, a bit small, on the 4th floor - with nicer loungers and a large bar and cabana area. There is a small gym, with nice equipment on the 2nd floor with floor to ceiling windows overlooking 5th St - kind of nice. The restaurant Suite & Tender, looked good. We only went there for the wine hour. There is also a lobby bar, which was nice as well. Free wifi. Nice place, I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST THE BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: Manny S
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was very good. When I first came here I was very impressed by the big door (although I was a bit shaken by all the homeless people on the streets) Good: - very well designed rooms - nice pool - helpful staff - nice view - big rooms - nice and big TV (for those of you who like to sit in your room all day) - house of blues nearby ( but not so close it's loud) - comfortable beds - everything is very clean and the bad: Hmmm...tricky... - hard to find parking (unless your willing to pay some money) - lots of homeless (who generely dont bug you or beg...just sit there...depressing) But mostly everything there is really good!!!! At first I thought it was a five star hotel!!!! Also, when we were there the water system was broken... and they didnt have hot water but that was only for the first two days of a week long trip :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: PatientInfoSeeker
Reviews.Content: Friendly and welcoming front desk staff. Comfortable and clean room. I erroneously thought my TV was not working properly and someone was promptly sent to look at it.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Property...”
Reviews.Author: bballtravel
Reviews.Content: First thing I hear when walking in is a guest saying, "I'm going to sue you guy's, I have a great lawyer." An older gentleman walking around who's some type of manager I assume (more on him later) merely said, "why would you want to sue us?" Not a good start.... The check in was seamless and we were offered an upgrade to a suite for $100 more. The 4th floor, apparently, is the pool floor, which is also where Siren club is located. We decided against it and stuck with our 4th floor room. The hotel did mention the 4th floor was noisy. Small room, but wasn't half-bad. The shower, like previous reviews, was not well thought out. Water all over the floor and you'd better be with someone who does not mind seeing you in the buff. The water on the floor did not bother me it is what it is. Room service menu is limited and we did not try it out. We did try calling around 1am for the limited overnight menu, but were told it's no longer available. Bummer. The bed was comfortable, but squeaky. Two of the light fixtures were unplugged, and our room was missing it's smoke detector. Simple oversight? No turndown service, either. Bummer x2 The noise from the club did not bother us. It's our belief that if you get your room via hotwire or any other discount website, you're placed on the 4th floor or anywhere near the pool. They're undesirable rooms, because anyone in their right mind would be bothered by the loud thumping and cussing and yelling from it's drunken patrons. The upsell to the larger suite for $100 more is to get you out of that mess, so to speak... Check out was a breeze. Now back to the older gentleman. He sits at a desk in the lobby, the mail man drops the mail on his desk, and he has a presence about him that adds to the Se. He's got an arrogant haughty type attitude, which fits this hotel perfectly. That's not a knock, however. It's a compliment and I'd welcome a chance to have wine with him during their free wine tasting on Friday. I'd come back if I got a good deal. We got $104 a night through hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel even better service”
Reviews.Author: nkim009
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a nice little getaway weekend. The hotel is located in downtown, the heart of the gaslamp district but becareful it is a little hard to find since it blends right in with the stores/areas that surround it. We were finally able to find it by seeing the valet people out in front. After walking into the hotel (they have very unique huge door that is pushed to enter) we were amazed by how beautiful it was inside. The hotel itself isn't huge but it is definitely beautiful. We upgraded our room to a larger suit with a HUGE balcony that wrapped around in the back. The room itself was beautiful! Decor is very modern and chic. The master bathroom was beautiful. Open shower with huge shower head, sunken tub- I loved it. The balcony at night was beautiful to see the lights of downtown. The only thing I would say is be warned that at night they do have a lounge/nightclubish music playing on the roof top that can be heard from the room. Service was great, very helpful. Would recommend this place to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & even better price”
Reviews.Author: guccichik
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! We were in town for a baseball game and wanted to be able to walk to Petco Park and that we did. The hotel is located in the Gaslamp District so there is plenty to do. The hotel has a great pool and cool lounge that is paired with an innovative restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I enjoyed the room, spa and room service!”
Reviews.Author: BekahH
Reviews.Content: We wanted comfort, nice things, a chance to get away from it all.... and we found that at Se San Diego. The linens were comfy and white, the shower was super contemporary with glass and stone, and flooring was a really pretty wood. The room service food was trendy and yum... I tried the lettuce wraps. The spa was quick to get us in and we tried a massage and a facial. We loved taking walks every morning. Within walking distance was the harbor with it's dining, sightseeing and whale watching or dinner cruises as well as the San Diego Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “NEW SURPRISE in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: bicocchinaonesta
Reviews.Content: We've been in San Diego 2 times and we had some issue with the choice of the hotel. This time we've been really surprised by SE Hotel. The building is new, the position is perfect (near Gas Lamp Qt) and the deluxe sky-view room was amazing. Will come back at SE hotel for sure next time that we'll be in town. Enjoy the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: VivaRobVegas
Reviews.Content: I had read several reviews about the Se and only booked because I got a very good deal. So its fair to say I had some apprehension given the mixed feelings of other reviewers, but any concerns very quickly disappeared upon arrival. It is very difficult to recognise from the street and I only found it because I knew it was next to the House of Blues. The valet & bell staff upon arrival were extremely friendly, and this continued inside with the reception staff & concierge friendly, attentive and very welcoming. The lobby area is very funky with a Zen inspired chic, and the enormous door from the street is a fun novelty. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a room overlooking the pool, our 10th floor vantage point gave us additional views of the city to the north. As some reviews have suggested, the room was quite small, but very comfortable and modern. The dark timber floors and stone bathroom were a nice touch but the pillow top mattress was certainly the highlight. It was so comfortable and easily one of the best hotel beds I've slept in. It is comparable, if not better, than Starwood's Heavenly beds. I really loved the room, but light sleepers beware. We weren't disturbed by the House of Blues - it was the pool area at night that turns into an outdoor nightclub/bar with loud music pumped out on the weekends. We were advised on check in of this, so it was no surprise to hear it from our room, but it didn't cause us any real disturbance. Suite & Tender, the onsite bar & restaurant is easily accessed, and whilst we didn't experience the bar, the restaurant was outstanding. The spectacular food was perfectly matched with exceptional service, and it was easily the best dining experience I've had in San Diego by a long way. I cannot speak highly enough of it. Valet parking is available at around $36 per night, but with in-out privileges, it is worth it compared to local garages. I overheard some staff chatting about possible new ownership, so whatever happens with the Se, I hope they don't change the format or service levels too much. This is an excellent San Diego hotel in a prime location with the delights of the Gaslamp Quarter at your doorstep. The outstanding service & friendliness enhanching what is a fantastic and extremely comfortable property made for a truly memorable and positive stay.

Reviews.Title: “Most disappointing hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jsand1389
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed decent upon check in, and the room was nice enough. However, the experience following was absolutely miserable! The first night we were treated terribly in the hotel bar, where the bartender seemed more interested in getting off of work than treating the customers with care. He was extremely rude. The following night over shadowed the previous with flying colors. We returned to our room after an entire day out in San diego only to find a room that had not been cleaned. Upon calling the front desk, the "manager" accused me of having left the do not disturb sign on the door. His only offer was to send up 2 fresh towels and expected me to be satisfied by that. After spending $200 a night, and $36 on parking alone... I was livid. I would advise against this hotel to any friend or family member for many reasons, but primarily because of the extreme disrespect I felt from the staff. DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY TO STAY HERE!

HotelInfo.Name: Palomar San Diego, A Kimpton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1047 5th Avenue, San Diego, CA 92101
